name: Push-Up

instructions.description: Start in a high plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width and feet together or hip-width apart.
Engage your core and glutes, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Lower your chest toward the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them at a 30–45 degree angle from your torso.
Lower until your chest is just above the floor or elbows reach approximately 90 degrees.
Press through your palms to return to the starting position while maintaining full-body tension.

performanceMetrics.notes: Controlled repetitions with full range of motion.
Can be performed as time-based sets (e.g., max reps in 30–60 seconds).
Typically increases to moderate levels; higher with continuous or high-volume sets.
Should remain rhythmic; exhale during the push phase.
Primary activation in chest, triceps, shoulders, and core stabilizers.

commentsNotes: Maintain a neutral spine and avoid sagging hips.
Keep elbows slightly tucked to protect shoulders.
If wrist discomfort occurs, use push-up handles or fists.
Warm up shoulders, elbows, and wrists before performing.
